Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
Dear members. We would like to encourage our community to help new members in #support and #deleted-channel channel and optionally on other channels. We will be awarding 5 KMD bounty for the best support cases via our Tipbot. This would encourage users to get a more diverse experience with our tech and products. As a whole, this will build knowledgable and resourceful Komodo community.
Learn, help, spread the knowledge and may the force be with you.

Advice to users:
- Please don't provide or post your private key
- Always keep yourself safe and your data safe
- If you are unsure about anything, please ask
- Using TeamViewer is not recommended and may bring security risk

Author: radix42#3743
Content: hey @KomodoWorld I had a question about if you know of anyone working a couple of the bigger bounties posted at: https://forum.komodoplatform.com/c/jobs-bounties/bounties

Author: radix42#3743
Content: like, is anyone besides myself whack enough to go after the EWASM and Solidity ones?

Author: radix42#3743
Content: and if so have they gotten anywhere to your knowledge?

Author: radix42#3743
Content: don't wanna bust my butt if someone else is almost there!

Author: radix42#3743
Content: ^^^ @jl777c I am down to this part of my TODO list it seems

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I doubt anybody else has made any meaningful progress

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the key to all these language ones is to allow calling a txid

Author: radix42#3743
Content: that's what i thought, as "step zero" is what you just said lol

Author: radix42#3743
Content: need to convert back and forth between utxo and account model

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so in the txid is an opreturn with the functions code, parameters in the opreturn, results too

Author: radix42#3743
Content: think i know where to stick that in as a shim in the layer between the EVM and the blockchain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and access to blockchain variables that are useful

Author: radix42#3743
Content: the EVM does everything based on a balance in an address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: blockhash, txid, utxo amounts, etc. basically a useful system that can be used

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can use getaddressbalance

Author: radix42#3743
Content: yup

Author: radix42#3743
Content: what I'm planning on doing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: most of the time it will work, just need to have a reserve for txfees

Author: radix42#3743
Content: yeah, mapping that to gas

Author: radix42#3743
Content: this is gonna be some hella deep voodoo

Author: radix42#3743
Content: good thing my grandpa was from the swamps of Louisiana, no joke!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: need to prevent recursion, or at least extreme recursion

Author: radix42#3743
Content: yeah they missed that one lol

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: lots of interesting issues to make a useful system,

Author: radix42#3743
Content: we'll get there, I just wanna pull in all those ethereum dAPP devs

Author: radix42#3743
Content: like ballmer said, its all about "DEVELOPERS! DEVELOPERS! DEVELOPERS!"

Author: radix42#3743
Content: "psst, hey, you, dAPP developer....wanna scaling solution that gives you your own sidechain and is secured by bitcoin's hashpower?"

Content: I like playing long games üòÉ

Author: radix42#3743
Content: while eth farts around with their busted ass sharding BS lol

Content: it so much more efficient to just write a natively running CC but having interpreted languages is a good stepping stone

Content: its what all the kids are used to

Author: radix42#3743
Content: they were shocked on twitter at me waiting multi hours for native builds on RISC-V and ARM64 boards with slow IO

Content: fuck a PIVX RISC-V build took OVERNIGHT

Author: radix42#3743
Content: (i was tossing a bone to the masternode privacy coin fetishists)

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content:
@radix42 Solidity bounty is still open but I'm no longer sure if it makes sense with the CC modules already so advanced. What could it be used for? If it's useful I can keep it or I can repurpose the bounty to something else 

The Wasm bounty is still open too, but just the other day @mrlynch asked me about that one and he's interested too... So I'm not sure what I should do if suddenly there are 2 people interested at the same time üòü        

Emmanuel is working on the Python one

Maybe is there something else that could be useful? Any idea? @jl777c

Content: they are useful in that they will add ethereum dAPP compatibility

Content: but ok, perhaps it's no longer useful to port existing Ethereum Dapps (at this point it will be easier to rewrite them w CC), but could attract developers from Ethereum

It is with pleasure, I announce the winner. Congratulations @papawib ! Below is the winning design that will be used as the MineTheChains logo. You will be !arrrtip‚Äôd your 2500 ARRR winnings in the MTC discord shortly.
For everyone that isn‚Äôt familiar, MineTheChains is an Equihash Komodo & KMD Assetchain mining pool. We offer mining for Komodo & Pirate at this time, but are in the processing of adding more assetchains.
